intro: Ludwigia octovalvis var. octofila, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers and dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in shallow, nutrient-rich waters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and aquariums due to its vibrant colors and ease of care. The leaves are usually arranged in whorls of eight, giving the plant its scientific name "octovalvis," which refers to the eight-valved structure of its flowers.
